Saigon Legend: A Feast for the Eyes and Tastebuds at West Coast Plaza

My recent lunch at Saigon Legend in West Coast Plaza wasn't just a meal; it was a sensory journey.

As I walked in, instead of just smelling the food, my attention was immediately drawn to the large TV panel showcasing close-up, mouth-watering videos of authentic Saigon cuisine. The vibrant colors, the glistening sauces, the perfectly arranged herbs - it was a visual feast that set the stage for the delicious meal to come. It truly amplified the anticipation!

I started with the traditional saigon Banh Mi with pork, a Vietnamese staple. The baguette was perfectly crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, providing the ideal vessel for the savoury filling. The pork was tender and flavourful, complemented by fresh cilantro and carrots. It was a symphony of textures and tastes, a truly satisfying sandwich.

To accompany the Banh Mi, I ordered the Vietnamese drip coffee without milk. The slow drip method yielded a strong, rich, and aromatic brew. It was the perfect pick-me-up, with a bold flavour that lingered on the palate.

Next up was the fresh Vietnamese wrap (the non-fried type). These delicate rolls were packed with fresh lettuce and succulent prawns. The accompanying fish sauce was zesty and flavourful, adding a delightful sweetness to the dish. It was a light and refreshing option, perfect for a warm afternoon.

To quench my thirst, I opted for the lemongrass drink infused with pandan leaves. The lemongrass provided a citrusy note, while the pandan added a subtle sweetness. It was a fragrant and refreshing beverage, the perfect complement to the savoury dishes.

The portions were generous, and the prices were reasonable, making Saigon Legend an excellent value for money. The service was friendly and efficient, adding to the overall positive experience.

If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese cuisine in a relaxed and inviting setting, Saigon Legend at West Coast Plaza is a must-try. From the flavourful Banh Mi to the fragrant lemongrass-pandan drink, it was a very friendly and enjoyable sensory experience to the rich culinary heritage of Vietnam.

Highly recommended!
